intro: Linum usitatissimum subsp. intermedium, commonly known as intermediate flax, is a subspecies of the flax plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its slender stems and blue to purple flowers, which bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and has lance-shaped leaves with a slightly hairy texture. It thrives in temperate climates and prefers well-drained soil. This subspecies is often cultivated for its fibers, which are used in textile production, and its seeds, which can be pressed for oil.
